intro: Galium nebulosum, commonly known as the mistletoe gallium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Galium nebulosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
